channel.title: Comments on: WGW 38: I Want to Play Go Like That…

item.title: By: Todd Bowlby
item.dc:creator: Todd Bowlby
item.description: Unfortunately, no, hulu and most services anything like it don't work in Canada at all. We do have netflix.ca, but it's not nearly as good as in the US. There is a way to cheat, of course, using proxy services so that they are technically streaming to an IP registered in the US. I simply don't want to think too much about the stupidity of it all, so I'll just have to wait twenty years until the laws and business models reflect the reality of ten years ago.
item.content:encoded:
Unfortunately, no, hulu and most services anything like it don’t work in Canada at all. We do have netflix.ca, but it’s not nearly as good as in the US.
There is a way to cheat, of course, using proxy services so that they are technically streaming to an IP registered in the US. I simply don’t want to think too much about the stupidity of it all, so I’ll just have to wait twenty years until the laws and business models reflect the reality of ten years ago.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: I heard that it doesn't unfortunately. =( Let me know if you find out otherwise though!
item.content:encoded: I heard that it doesn’t unfortunately. =( Let me know if you find out otherwise though!

item.title: By: 1st Washington Open Baduk Championship - Part II | BenGoZen
item.dc:creator: 1st Washington Open Baduk Championship - Part II | BenGoZen

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Haha. Agreed. Though like I mentioned above to Daurak, what was interesting about this game was that it wasn't like her moves were particularly new or unique. Like it wasn't a tesuji or anything, it was as if the normal moves she were making had their own life and quality to them. =D
item.content:encoded: Haha. Agreed. Though like I mentioned above to Daurak, what was interesting about this game was that it wasn’t like her moves were particularly new or unique. Like it wasn’t a tesuji or anything, it was as if the normal moves she were making had their own life and quality to them. =D

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: What's interesting is that it's not so much that her moves were brilliant tesuji or anything. It was just an emotion that overcame me as I watched her play. And to be honest, they seemed like perfectly ordinary moves you or I would play, but it felt totally different. Probably sounds crazy... but that's how it felt. Hope you can find a good version of the anime soon! I still love the manga for being the original, but it's nice to see the anime from time to time.
item.content:encoded:
What’s interesting is that it’s not so much that her moves were brilliant tesuji or anything. It was just an emotion that overcame me as I watched her play. And to be honest, they seemed like perfectly ordinary moves you or I would play, but it felt totally different. Probably sounds crazy… but that’s how it felt.
Hope you can find a good version of the anime soon! I still love the manga for being the original, but it’s nice to see the anime from time to time.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: That's great that you are able to appreciate professional games so early on in your journey. I know that I've always had issues being able to see their moves and probably still do to some extent. What I will say is that Game 3 was definitely not an attempt for me to imitate professionals. Haha. That was just me being unable to be calm and just trying to kill everything I could. =D If it were an attempt to imitate professionals, I think I wouldn't be nearly as ashamed of it. Haha. Appreciate hearing your side of things. Definitely reminds me that I have a ways to go when it comes to how I review professional games. =)
item.content:encoded:
That’s great that you are able to appreciate professional games so early on in your journey. I know that I’ve always had issues being able to see their moves and probably still do to some extent.
What I will say is that Game 3 was definitely not an attempt for me to imitate professionals. Haha. That was just me being unable to be calm and just trying to kill everything I could. =D If it were an attempt to imitate professionals, I think I wouldn’t be nearly as ashamed of it. Haha.
Appreciate hearing your side of things. Definitely reminds me that I have a ways to go when it comes to how I review professional games. =)

item.title: By: Daurak
item.dc:creator: Daurak
item.description: That's why I spend most my time reviewing professional games. Their moves are beautiful and powerful. Quiet, yet full of meaning. I enjoy every game I review, and will stay up late hours going over them. I have to slow myself down in game, though, because my reading ability is obviously not on par with theirs. For game three of yours, to me it looked like what I do sometimes. I really want to play like a pro so most of my stones are light and efficient, but to play light you have to read a lot. By playing solid, our thick, it gives me the upper hand in some of the fights.
item.content:encoded: That’s why I spend most my time reviewing professional games. Their moves are beautiful and powerful. Quiet, yet full of meaning. I enjoy every game I review, and will stay up late hours going over them. I have to slow myself down in game, though, because my reading ability is obviously not on par with theirs. For game three of yours, to me it looked like what I do sometimes. I really want to play like a pro so most of my stones are light and efficient, but to play light you have to read a lot. By playing solid, our thick, it gives me the upper hand in some of the fights.

item.title: By: Todd Bowlby
item.dc:creator: Todd Bowlby
item.description: I think I need to get a little stronger yet, in order to feel that way about well-played Go. Nice to think it can happen before an amateur makes shodan! I really have to watch Hikaru all the way through. I read the manga, but I've never watched the anime all the way through (it's not on Netflix in Canada or anything like that, so when I've looked I've only found bad transfers on youtube available, or DRM itunes stuff that I can't stream to my TV ... maybe I'll go see if I can actually buy disks somewhere...).
item.content:encoded: I think I need to get a little stronger yet, in order to feel that way about well-played Go. Nice to think it can happen before an amateur makes shodan! I really have to watch Hikaru all the way through. I read the manga, but I’ve never watched the anime all the way through (it’s not on Netflix in Canada or anything like that, so when I’ve looked I’ve only found bad transfers on youtube available, or DRM itunes stuff that I can’t stream to my TV … maybe I’ll go see if I can actually buy disks somewhere…).

item.title: By: PericlesBaduk
item.dc:creator: PericlesBaduk
item.description: About the last paragraph, this is pretty much I I feel when I watch those Pro vs Ama games that I enjoy reviewing afterwards. Gives me chills almost everytime, to see all those beautiful simple but sharp moves. Love that feeling ^^
item.content:encoded: About the last paragraph, this is pretty much I I feel when I watch those Pro vs Ama games that I enjoy reviewing afterwards. Gives me chills almost everytime, to see all those beautiful simple but sharp moves. Love that feeling ^^
